      • getThreadPoolName

        public String getThreadPoolName()
        Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
        Used to search for a org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.ThreadPool service registered in the kernel by the specified name. If not found then this setting will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        getThreadPoolName in interface JettyConfigBean

      • getMaxIdleTime

        public Integer getMaxIdleTime()
        Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
        Set the maximum Idle time for a connection, which roughly translates to the Socket.setSoTimeout(int) call, although with NIO implementations other mechanisms may be used to implement the timeout. The max idle time is applied:
      • When waiting for a new request to be received on a connection
      • When reading the headers and content of a request
      • When writing the headers and content of a response
Specified by:
getMaxIdleTime in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getLowResourceMaxIdleTime

    public Integer getLowResourceMaxIdleTime()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    The period in ms that a connection is allowed to be idle when there are more than low resource connections. This allows the server to rapidly close idle connections in order to gracefully handle high load situations.
    Specified by:
    getLowResourceMaxIdleTime in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getLowResourcesConnections

    public Integer getLowResourcesConnections()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    The number of connections, which if exceeded places this manager in low resources state. This is not an exact measure as the connection count is averaged over the select sets.
    Specified by:
    getLowResourcesConnections in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getAcceptors

    public Integer getAcceptors()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    The number of acceptor threads to set.
    Specified by:
    getAcceptors in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getAcceptorPriorityOffset

    public Integer getAcceptorPriorityOffset()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    The priority offset of the acceptor threads. The priority is adjusted by this amount (default 0) to either favour the acceptance of new threads and newly active connections or to favour the handling of already dispatched connections.
    Specified by:
    getAcceptorPriorityOffset in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getCorePoolSize

    public Integer getCorePoolSize()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    How many threads will be created before implementation (execution policy) starts looking for existing free thread. Note that this setting is ignored if JettyConfigBean.getThreadPoolName() resolves to a configured thread pool extension. Additionally, JettyConfigBean.getMaxPoolSize() must be defined as well.
    Specified by:
    getCorePoolSize in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getMaxPoolSize

    public Integer getMaxPoolSize()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    The maximum pool size is the upper bound on how many pool threads can be active at once. Note that this setting is ignored if JettyConfigBean.getThreadPoolName() resolves to a configured thread pool extension. Additionally, JettyConfigBean.getCorePoolSize()} must be defined as well.
    Specified by:
    getMaxPoolSize in interface JettyConfigBean

  • getPoolKeepAliveTime

    public Integer getPoolKeepAliveTime()
    Description copied from interface: JettyConfigBean
    If the pool has more than corePoolSize threads and there are more tasks to execute then implementation (execution policy) will terminate all excess threads (maximumPoolSize – coreThreadSize) which are idle for more than this time value in milliseconds. Note that this setting is ignored if JettyConfigBean.getThreadPoolName() resolves to a configured thread pool extension. This value is used in conjunction with JettyConfigBean.getCorePoolSize() and JettyConfigBean.getMaxPoolSize(), This is a BlockingQueue used for holding tasks awaiting execution. There is direct relation between work queue and pool sizing.
    Specified by:
    getPoolKeepAliveTime in interface JettyConfigBean
